p: NOâ€™s actions can be mediated by soluble guanylyl cyclase (GC), resulting in an increase in cGMP that can modify the properties of ion channels such as K ATP. NO-cGMP-K ATP axis has gastroprotective effects, and since the efflux of potassium promotes the blocking of voltage-sensitive calcium channels, it leads to the relaxation of smooth muscles, favoring blood flow and the arrival of growth factors and cell renewal that facilitate the ulcer healing process [ 184]. The gastroprotective effect of baicalein involves the NO-cGMP-K ATP pathway, accelerating the healing of ulcers [ 81].
